semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for General Medical Examinations with Abnormal Findings
section_path: Section IV > Diagnostic Coding and Reporting Guidelines for Outpatient Services > P. Encounters for general medical examinations with abnormal findings

content.full_text: The subcategories for encounters for general medical examinations, Z00.0- and encounter for routine child health examination, Z00.12-, provide codes for with and without abnormal findings. Should a general medical examination result in an abnormal finding, the code for general medical examination with abnormal finding should be assigned as the first-listed diagnosis. An examination with abnormal findings refers to a condition/diagnosis that is newly identified or a change in severity of a chronic condition (such as uncontrolled hypertension, or an acute exacerbation of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease) during a routine physical examination. A secondary code for the abnormal finding should also be coded. (Evidence: pg no: 115, L29-L34)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding general medical examinations when abnormal findings are discovered, requiring specific Z code selection and secondary coding of findings (Evidence: pg no: 115, L29-L34)
